initial.title: Step 0: Initial State
initial.description:
Optimal (OPT) is the theoretically best page replacement algorithm.

Core Rules:
- Replace page used FARTHEST in future
- Requires perfect knowledge of entire page sequence
- If page is NEVER used again: Highest priority for replacement
- Tie-breaker: Lowest frame number (frame ID)

We have {num_frames} frames with initial pages: {frame_list}

Note: This algorithm is used as a benchmark - it cannot be implemented in practice without knowing future page requests.

page_hit.description:
Page {page} is requested.

Page {page} is already in Frame {frame_id}.

Result: PAGE HIT - No replacement needed.

No changes to memory. We move to the next page request.

page_fault.title: Step {step}: Page {page} - FAULT
page_fault.description:

Page {page} is NOT in memory.

Result: PAGE FAULT - Replacement needed.
